cards.rules_text: [i](Mark your {V} counters here.)[/i]

Whenever you attack, you may sacrifice another creature. When you do, choose two—
• Create two 1/1 red and white Soldier creature tokens with haste that are tapped and attacking.
• You draw a card and you lose 1 life.
• Caesar, Legion's Emperor deals damage equal to the number of creature tokens you control to target opponent.
You gain 2 life. Then counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}, where X is the amount of life you've gained this turn.
Cards can't leave exile or be cast from exile.

—Caesar[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever one or more +1/+1 counters are put on Lauded Victor or an Equipment is attached to Lauded Victor, create a Treasure token. This ability triggers only once each turn. [i](It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)[/i]

Glory [i](Whenever this attacks, you get {V}, a glory counter, then you may activate this card's glory ability.)[/i]
{V}{V}| Create a 1/1 red and white Soldier creature token with haste that's tapped and attacking.

When Oracle of the Legion enters the battlefield, surveil 2. When you do, Oracle of the Legion deals damage to any target equal to the number of cards in your graveyard. [i](To surveil 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest on top of your library in any order.)[/i]
When Fraulian Deathworm enters the battlefield, create two tapped Treasure tokens, then Fraulian Deathworm deals damage to any target equal to the number of tokens you control.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Why do your tribesmen call it a deathworm?”
“Don't worry about it.”[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Libius yearned for the comforts of home. The public baths. The games of calcio. Wine and flatbread. Not having a knife in his eye.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Choose target creature you control. You may create a Gladius Arms token. If you do, attach it to that creature. Then that creature fights target creature you don't control. Equipped creature gets +2/+0 and has “Whenever this creature deals excess damage, create a Treasure token.”
Equip {2}

Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
Equipped creatures you control get +1/+0.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“My empire was carved with a sharp blade and rests safely on a strong shield.”
—Caesar[/i]

cards.rules_text: Each player sacrifices an artifact or nonbasic land.
cards.flavor_text: [i]War never changes, but war changes everything.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Target creature you control deals damage equal to its toughness to any nonplayer target.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“They may cleave to rigid tactics, but it is a mistake to assume the Avictans are incapable of the element of surprise.”
—Hamilbas[/i]

Draw a card.
Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is its toughness.

• You take imperium. [i](Creatures you cast enter the battlefield with an extra +1/+1 counter. You lose imperium at the end of your turn if you didn't attack or cast a creature spell.)[/i]
• Look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.

Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or creature with flying. Scry 1.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Once given the signal, Sullo's legionnaires darkened the sky. No hawks or harpies would impede his progress.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Though his age and experience has turned his attention to politics, he needs only the slightest urging to take up the pilum once more.[/i]

cards.rules_text:

[i](As this enters, choose an opponent to protect it. You and others can attack it.)[/i]
When Fenexian Gambit enters the battlefield, each opponent creates a 3/3 green Elephant creature token.
When Fenexian Gambit is defeated, search your library and/or graveyard for a creature card and put it on the battlefield. If you search your library this way, shuffle.
Decayed [i](This creature can't block. When it attacks, sacrifice it at end of combat.)[/i]
